Legal_Issue: Whether the Applicants met the tri-partite test for a stay of removal
Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Evidence_Type: Lack of clear evidence of irreparable harm
Legal_Provision: Tri-partite test for stay of removal
Evaluation_Standard: Serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to show legal error in H&C Officer's decision; lack of irreparable harm; public interest in enforcing removal
Application_Error: Applicants failed to demonstrate legal error in H&C decision
Legal_Standard: Tri-partite test: (1) serious issue to be tried, (2) irreparable harm, (3) balance of convenience
Application_Factor: Public interest in efficient enforcement of removal orders
Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of serious issue, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Tri-partite test for stay of removal
Cause_of_Refusal: Applicants did not satisfy the tri-partite test
Evidentiary_Issues: No clear evidence of irreparable harm
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to H&C Officer's decision via judicial review
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) - implied
Procedural_Issue: Filing of judicial review motion for stay of removal
Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient evidence of irreparable harm
